intro: Pseudoxytenanthera tenuispiculata, commonly known as the slender-spined xytenanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
